Notes: {"c1": {"status": "unclear", "evidence": "The abstract refers to students and second language learners in general but does not specify that the participants are L2 English learners in ESL/EFL/ELL contexts, nor does it describe an actual learner sample; it mainly presents a system description and simulation results."}, "c2": {"status": "fail", "evidence": "The study introduces an AI-assisted deep learning\u2013based automatic correction system for English composition errors. The description focuses on preprocessing, feature extraction, and dynamic time normalization, which are characteristic of traditional ML/DL, not transformer-based generative LLMs."}, "c3": {"status": "fail", "evidence": "The primary focus is on developing an automatic essay correction and grading system to support teachers\u2019 correction and data analysis.
